DOC.brief_summary: This primary aim study assess effect active versus passive ( second-hand ) inhalation cannabis smoke toxicological analysis `` native '' oral fluid ( saliva ) blood specimen . The result study help inform validity oral fluid biomarker cannabis exposure determine whether , long , passive inhalation cannabis smoke could result positive toxicology result .
DOC.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic Pharmacodynamic Effects Passive Cannabis Inhalation
DOC.criteria: Participants must : 1 . Be age 18 45 2 . Be good general health base physical examination , medical history , vital sign , 12lead ECG screen urine blood test 3 . Demonstrate ability expectorate 35 mL `` native '' oral fluid 5minute period 4 . Be willing able abstain use overthecounter ( OTC ) prescription drug ( birth control medication ) provide write informed consent continue discharge study . OTC antacid may take 12 hour prior dose 5 . Not pregnant nursing ( female ) , use effective birth control . All female must negative serum pregnancy test Screening Visit negative urine pregnancy test clinic admission . 6 . Have body mass index ( BMI ) range 19 33 kg/m2 7 . Have head hair least 46 cm ( approximately two inch ) length back head . 8 . Blood pressure Screening Visit must exceed systolic blood pressure ( SBP ) 140 mmHg diastolic blood pressure ( DBP ) 90 mmHg 9 . Must history significant medical psychiatric illness judge investigator put participant great risk experience adverse event due exposure completion study procedure . 10 . Can enrol another clinical trial receive drug part research study within 30 day prior dose . 11 . No history panic/anxiety reaction extend period confinement close quarter , smoke fill area , tight social situation . 12 . No history adverse reaction cannabis exposure , whether via direct use passive exposure .
